intro: Tetratheca stenocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruit tetra-theca, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically white or pink in color. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain multiple seeds, and it is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Tetratheca stenocarpa is adapted to arid environments and is typically found in open habitats such as heathlands and coastal areas.
